etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin percussio(n-), from the verb percutere ‘to strike forcibly’ (see percuss)

definitions: musical instruments played by striking with the hand or with a handheld or pedal-operated stick or beater, or by shaking, including drums, cymbals, xylophones, gongs, bells, and rattles
shortDefinitions: musical instruments played by striking with hand or with stick or beater, or by shaking, including drums, cymbals, xylophones

definitions: the striking of one solid object with or against another with some degree of force

examples.text: the clattering percussion of objects striking the walls and the shutters

shortDefinitions: striking of one solid object with or against another with some degree of force

definitions: the action of tapping a part of the body as part of a diagnosis

examples.text: the chest sounded dull on percussion

shortDefinitions: action of tapping part of body as part of diagnosis
